New Records: Harry Kane became the 10th player to reach 100 caps for England in the match against Finland, leaving him 25 caps short of Peter Shilton's all-time record.
Pre-Game Insights: Harry Kane expressed his desire to continue playing for England for a long time, inspired by Cristiano Ronaldo's achievements. Interim manager Lee Carsley mentioned using Kane effectively in his first game in charge and noted the lack of English talent ready to take his place.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match included a special presentation for Harry Kane's 100th cap with a golden cap and a tribute to Sven-Goran Eriksson, the first non-British manager of the England national team.
Others: The article discusses Kane's future and the potential decisions regarding his role in the team, as well as the impact of his performance at major tournaments.
